amendment.description: An amendment to reduce funds appropriated in the bill for the White House by $500,000. The intent of the amendment would be to use those funds to reimburse 7 former members of the White House Travel Office for legal fees incurred relating to their termination.

action.text: Mr. Hoyer raised a point of order against the Salmon amendment (A014). Mr. Hoyer stated that the amendment offered by Mr. Salmon did not specifically address the issues described in the unanimous consent agreement of July 16, 1996 and was, therefore, outside the scope of the agreement and not in order. The Chair sustained the point of order.
